noun.description: An internal or external framework of bone, cartilage, or other rigid material supporting or containing the body of an animal or plant.
The supporting framework, basic structure, or essential part of something.
examples: the concrete skeleton of an unfinished building

noun.description: A small sled for one person, ridden head first while lying in a prone position.
examples: the skeleton's runners make a terrifying rumbling sound as they slide down the ice
she can hit 70+ mph on her skeleton sled

phrases: The couple, devout Catholics, don't seem to have any skeletons in the closet, until the police dig deeper.
Brooke had some dirty laundry and some skeletons in the closet that she would not have liked brought to light, but she rarely tried to persecute others through her own misdeeds.
But she isn't the only one with a skeleton in the closet; Danny is hiding a secret of his own.
It is the skeleton in the closet, the Pandora's box yet unopened.
First and foremost is that there should not be any skeletons in the cupboard.
origin: Late 16th century: modern Latin, from Greek, neuter of skeletos dried up, from skellein dry up.
